subject: Tax Evasion
Indianapolis 500 (Auto Race)
lead_paragraph: Hélio Castroneves, a two-time Indianapolis 500 winner and a winner of ABC’s “Dancing With The Stars,” was indicted on tax evasion and tax fraud charges in Miami, accused of using offshore accounts to hide millions of dollars in income from the Internal Revenue Service. Castroneves, 33, is charged with conspiracy and six counts of tax evasion for failing to report about $5.5 million in income between 1999 and 2004, according to court documents. Each count carries a maximum five-year prison sentence.
